intro: Cyphostemma biternatum, commonly known as the desert milkvine, is a climbing shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, followed by orange to red berries. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments, storing water in its stems and having a deep root system. Cyphostemma biternatum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
